TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract ICredentials

Docs.summary: Provides the base authentication interface for retrieving credentials for Web client authentication.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Net.ICredentials> interface provides the <xref:System.Net.ICredentials.GetCredential%2A> method to objects that supply network credentials to applications.
## Examples The following example illustrates how to use the <xref:System.Net.ICredentials> interface.
:::code language="cpp" source="~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/ICredential/CPP/icredential.cpp" id="Snippet1"::: :::code language="csharp" source="~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/ICredential/CS/icredential.cs" id="Snippet1"::: :::code language="vb" source="~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/ICredential/VB/icredential.vb" id="Snippet1":::

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Net.NetworkCredential GetCredential (Uri uri, string authType);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Net.NetworkCredential GetCredential(class System.Uri uri, string authType) cil managed
Public Function GetCredential (uri As Uri, authType As String) As NetworkCredential
abstract member GetCredential : Uri * string -> System.Net.NetworkCredential
public: System::Net::NetworkCredential ^ GetCredential(Uri ^ uri, System::String ^ authType);
public System.Net.NetworkCredential? GetCredential (Uri uri, string authType);

Docs.param: The that the client is providing authentication for.
The type of authentication, as defined in the property.
Docs.summary: Returns a object that is associated with the specified URI, and authentication type.
Docs.returns: The that is associated with the specified URI and authentication type, or, if no credentials are available, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Net.ICredentials.GetCredential%2A> method returns a <xref:System.Net.NetworkCredential> instance that contains the credentials that are associated with the specified URI and authorization scheme. When no credentials are available, the <xref:System.Net.ICredentials.GetCredential%2A> method returns `null`.
## Examples The following uses <xref:System.Net.ICredentials.GetCredential%2A> to retrieve a <xref:System.Net.NetworkCredential> instance.
:::code language="cpp" source="~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/ICredential/CPP/icredential.cpp" id="Snippet1"::: :::code language="csharp" source="~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/ICredential/CS/icredential.cs" id="Snippet1"::: :::code language="vb" source="~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/ICredential/VB/icredential.vb" id="Snippet1":::
